tccc.entry.accessible_music_discs.page_0: Otherside discs are dropped by creepers killed by skeletons. Creepers killed by piglins drop a pigstep disc. Creepers killed by the warden's sonic boom drop "5" music disc shards. Creepers killed by %s now drop relic music discs.
tccc.entry.accessible_music_discs.page_1: Creator, Creator (Music Box), and Precipice music discs are dropped by creepers killed by breezes.
tccc.entry.accessible_music_discs.title: –î–æ—Å—Ç—É–ø–Ω—ã–µ –ø–ª–∞—Å—Ç–∏–Ω–∫–∏
tccc.entry.amethyst_dust.page_0.descript: Amethyst dust is a potion ingredient used to create %s. It is dropped by %s, rarely traded by the %s, and drops 2.5%% of the time from fully grown amethyst buds.
tccc.entry.ancient_city_archaeology.hint: This structure can be found in the darkest depths of the world.
tccc.entry.ancient_city_archaeology.page: The ancient city now has small archaeology sections, which include the "Mourner" and "Plenty" pottery sherds (transferred from the %s), along with swift sneak books, the "Ward" trim, and the "Silence" trim (incredibly rarely.)
Snowy %s villagers (those with a snowy outfit, found in snowy villages) will sell a map to ancient cities, giving you a better method than "dig around under snowy mountains" to find them.
tccc.entry.apple_pie.page_0.description: Apple pie is a nourishing new food item that gives usage to apples if you don't have any gold to make golden apples. It's basically the apple version of pumpkin pie. There's also a %s.
tccc.entry.apple_pie.page_1.description: The above recipe is shapeless, meaning it can be put anywhere in the crafting space.
tccc.entry.archaeologist.page_0.descript:
The archaeologist is a new villager that uses the %s as its workstation.

Its trades are listed on the following pages.
tccc.entry.archaeologist.page_1.descript:
Level 1: Emeralds -> sand, red sand, or gravel; Emeralds -> enchanted brush

Level 2: Clay balls -> emerald; Emeralds -> blank decorated pot

Level 3: Emerald -> concrete powder; Feathers -> emerald
tccc.entry.archaeologist.page_2.descript:
Level 4: Emeralds -> "Friend" pottery sherd (enabling %s); Emeralds + compass -> trail ruins explorer map

Level 5: Random trail ruins armor trim %s
tccc.entry.archaeologist.page_3.descript: When you have hero of the village, archaeologists will give you sniffer eggs and "friend" pottery sherds.
tccc.entry.archaeologist.page_4.descript:
Taiga/Plains: Trail Ruins
Snowy: %s
Jungle: %s
Desert: Desert Temple, %s
Swamp: Ocean Ruins
Savanna: %s
The %s is very helpful for this feature.
tccc.entry.archaeologist.page_5.descript: When you have hero of the village, archaeologists will give you bricks, decorated pots, and brushes.
You can now put arms onto armor stands by adding sticks to them in a crafting table. You can also pose said armor stands by right-clicking them with a %s to give them some cool poses.
Some of the poses you can give the armor stands. This is only three out of many different poses!
The above recipe is shapeless, meaning it can be made from any variation of an armor stand and two sticks.
tccc.entry.armor_stand_with_arms.title: –†—É–∫–∞—Å—Ç—ã–µ —Å—Ç–æ–π–∫–∏ –¥–ª—è –±—Ä–æ–Ω–∏
tccc.entry.armor_trim_addon.hint: These items can be used to decorate your armor.
tccc.entry.armor_trim_addon.page_0.descr: The armor trim addon adds 5 new armor trims and can be installed by going to this %s. The following pages list the new armor trims and their locations.
tccc.entry.armor_trim_addon.page_1.descr:
Crystalline: Dropped by %s 1/8th of the time

Aurora: Dropped by %s 1/4th of the time

Barren: Found in %s archaeology
tccc.entry.armor_trim_addon.page_2.descr:
Interloper: Found in %s archaeology

Secret Trim: Found in the %s you can find using the %s.

Good luck finding them all!
tccc.entry.armor_trim_addon.title: Armor Trim Addon
tccc.entry.axolotl_bucket_variants.page_: Axolotl buckets now have proper variants, so you can see what type of axolotl you have in your bucket. This also works with baby axolotls, which are insanely cute.
LOOK AT THEM. CUTENESS OVERLOAD. TOO CUTE. CANNOT... WRITE... DESCRIPTION...
tccc.entry.axolotl_bucket_variants.title: –í–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç—ã –≤–µ–¥—ë—Ä —Å –∞–∫—Å–æ–ª–æ—Ç–ª—è–º–∏
tccc.entry.badlands_temple.hint: This structure can be found buried in dunes of red sand.
tccc.entry.badlands_temple.page_0.descri: The badlands temple is a new structure that contains several traps and interesting details. It rewards the %s, a unique golden reward for the gold-filled biome. It also has heavily enchanted gold loot and a few diamonds as well.
tccc.entry.badlands_temple.page_1.descri:
The structure also has a hidden archaeology section that rewards three %s: "Horror", "Riches", and "Star".

If the %s is installed, it also has the "Barren" armor trim.
tccc.entry.badlands_temple.page_2.descri: The outside of the structure. Very similar to the desert temple.
tccc.entry.badlands_temple.page_3.descri: The outside of the structure. Very similar to the desert temple.
tccc.entry.badlands_temple.title: Badlands Temple
tccc.entry.bat_wing.page_0.description: Bat wings are dropped by bats in amounts of 1-2, and can be crafted into leather. Cats can also bring them as their %s. Helpful for early-game leather! They can also be crafted into %s as well.
tccc.entry.bat_wing.page_1.description: Just like the rabbit hide recipe, in a 2√ó2 square.
Mangrove roots and muddy mangrove roots now only drop sticks (or sticks & mud) unless broken with silk touch or shears.

Much less inventory clog than two root items.
tccc.entry.better_mangrove_roots.title: –£–ª—É—á—à–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –º–∞–Ω–≥—Ä–æ–≤—ã–µ –∫–æ—Ä–Ω–∏
tccc.entry.biome_based_fishing.page_0.de: The rarities of fish now depend on the biome you're in. Salmon are four times as common in rivers, tropical fish and pufferfish are twice as common in warm oceans, and %s are twice as common in frozen oceans.
tccc.entry.biome_based_fishing.title: –†—ã–±–∞–ª–∫–∞ –Ω–∞ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–µ –±–∏–æ–º–æ–≤
tccc.entry.blind_rage_potion.page_0.desc: The blind rage potion is made by brewing a %s into an awkward potion. It gives Strength III and Blindness for 15s, which can be extended to 30s with redstone. It cannot be amplified with glowstone, it but can be %s with %s.
tccc.entry.boomerang.page_0.description:
The boomerang is a fun weapon that bounces off walls, hits multiple enemies, and comes back to you!

It has 300 durability and accepts unbreaking, mending, and vanishing.
tccc.entry.boomerang.page_1.description:
It also breaks any crops or plants it flies through, replanting seeds if possible.

If it is caught on fire with lava, fire, or a campfire, it will smelt potatoes, cactus and chorus plants into their cooked results.
tccc.entry.boomerang.page_2.description: The planks in this recipe can be of any wood, not just oak.
tccc.entry.cake_improvements.page_0.desc: Cake can now be easily broken and picked up again, without destroying the cake in the process. It also has different textures depending on the number of slices.
tccc.entry.cake_improvements.title: –£–ª—É—á—à–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ç–æ—Ä—Ç–∞
Campfires will now drop unlit campfires when broken with an axe without silk touch. When broken with silk touch, they drop a lit campfire. When broken without an axe or silk touch, they drop coal.
tccc.entry.campfire_improvements.title: –£–ª—É—á—à–µ–Ω–∏—è –∫–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞
tccc.entry.cat_improvements.hint: These feline friends have several small improvements.
tccc.entry.cat_improvements.page_0.descr:
Cats can now bring %s and raw rabbit meat as part of their morning gift pool.

They can also now be tamed using tropical fish, instead of just cod and salmon.
tccc.entry.cat_improvements.title: Cat Improvements
tccc.entry.climbable_chains.page_0.descr: Chains can now be climbed like ladders. Very simple feature, but fun for builds and stuff.
tccc.entry.climbable_chains.title: –ö–∞—Ä–∞–±–∫–∞—é—â–∏–µ—Å—è —Ü–µ–ø–∏
tccc.entry.compendium_guide.title: –†—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–æ –ø–æ —Å–±–æ—Ä–Ω–∏–∫—É
tccc.entry.consistent_loom_recipe.page_0: The loom now takes four planks like all other workstations, rather than two.
tccc.entry.consistent_loom_recipe.title: –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–π —Ä–µ—Ü–µ–ø—Ç —Ç–∫–∞—Ü–∫–æ–≥–æ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–∫–∞
tccc.entry.consistent_rib_armor_trim_dup: This armor trim can be found in nether fortresses.
The "Rib" armor trim is now duplicated using nether bricks instead of netherrack. Fits the texture better.
tccc.entry.consistent_stair_recipe_yield: Stair recipes now give 6, rather than 4, making them have a 1-to-1 ratio like stonecutters.
tccc.entry.consistent_trapdoor_recipe_yi: Trapdoor recipes now give 6, rather than 2, since door recipes give 3 and trapdoors are half doors.
The only exception is iron trapdoors, which give 4 due to taking less material than the other trapdoors.
tccc.entry.coral_recipes.page_0.descript:
Coral fans and normal coral can be crafted into coral blocks. This also applies to dead coral. An example recipe is given on the next page, and all the others are in the default recipe book.

This makes coral completely renewable!
tccc.entry.coral_recipes.page_1.descript: This recipe can be used in the small crafting menu as well, as it is only 2√ó2.
tccc.entry.coral_recipes.title: –ö–æ—Ä–∞–ª–ª–æ–≤—ã–µ —Ä–µ—Ü–µ–ø—Ç—ã
tccc.entry.cracked_deepslate_tile_recipe: Cracked deepslate tiles can now be made from cracked bricks. This also works in the stonecutter.
tccc.entry.craftable_snout_banner_patter: This piglin-related banner pattern is now craftable.
The snout banner pattern can now be crafted using a piglin head and a piece of paper, similarly to how the creeper and skull banner patterns are crafted. This makes the banner pattern renewable!
Very expensive, but useful if you can't find a bastion.
tccc.entry.crashed_end_ship.page_0.descr: The crashed end ship is a new structure that spawns rarely in the outer end islands, and contains the %s and minor loot as its cargo. It has been worn down with time and become infested with endermites.
tccc.entry.crashed_end_ship.page_1.descr: Looks like it had quite a rough landing.
tccc.entry.crashed_end_ship.title: –†–∞–∑–±–∏–≤—à–∏–π—Å—è –∫–æ—Ä–∞–±–ª—å –≠–Ω–¥–∞
tccc.entry.creaking_connector.hint: This redstone component can be made from a rare wooden heart.
tccc.entry.creaking_connector.page_0.des: The creaking connector is a useful redstone component that makes a form of wireless redstone, emulating the connection between creaking and creaking hearts. Clicking on one with any type of sapling creates a saplink.
tccc.entry.creaking_connector.page_1.des: When the saplink is right-clicked, the connector gives off a comparator signal based on the sapling type used. The darker the wood, the higher the signal. There is no distance limit to the connection, so have fun making pearl stasis machines!
tccc.entry.creaking_connector.page_2.des: It requires a creaking heart, so prepare for a spooky trip to your local pale garden (or woodland mansion!)
tccc.entry.cursed_crown.page_0.descripti: The cursed crown can be found in the %s. When worn, it replaces 80%% of your health with absorption health, which regenerates after 10 seconds of not taking damage. This health cannot be regenerated by any other means.
tccc.entry.cursed_crown.page_1.descripti: It comes with curse of binding. It also gives 3 armor, has 500 durability, and can be enchanted with any helmet enchantments.
tccc.entry.desert_well_rework.hint: This tiny desert structure has received a minor rework.
tccc.entry.desert_well_rework.page_0.des: The desert well has been slightly reworked. Its loot now has enchanted fishing rods, metal nuggets, emeralds, and the dune armor trim. It also has two layers of suspicious sand rather than one.
tccc.entry.desert_well_rework.page_1.des: Desert %s villagers (those with a desert outfit, found in desert villages) also trade a map to this structure if you can't find one in the vast desert.
tccc.entry.desert_well_rework.title: Desert Well Rework
tccc.entry.diluted_potions.page_0.descri: Diluted potions are a new potion type, created by brewing %s into a normal potion. Diluting a potion divides its duration into ten 'sips'. For example, diluting a 60 second speed potion gives you a 6 second diluted potion with ten uses.
tccc.entry.diluted_potions.page_1.descri: An example of brewing some diluted potions.
tccc.entry.diluted_potions.title: –†–∞–∑–±–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –∑–µ–ª—å—è
tccc.entry.dragon_head_renewability.page: The ender dragon now drops a dragon head when killed by a charged creeper. Good luck making that happen.
tccc.entry.drowned_variants.page_0.descr: Drowned can spawn covered in coral and sponge. Sponge drowned only spawn in ocean monuments. Drowned variants drop the material they're covered in, making these resources renewable and easier to access early-game.
tccc.entry.drowned_variants.page_1.descr: They blend right into the coral reefs! Except the sponge variant, he sticks out like a sore thumb.
tccc.entry.drowned_variants.title: –í–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç—ã —É—Ç–æ–ø–ª–µ–Ω–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤
tccc.entry.dyed_bundles.page_0.descripti: Bundles can now be dyed with every type of dye by adding the dye to the middle of the recipe. Great for sorting! Additionally, the bundle recipe has also been re-added. You cannot re-dye a bundle or dye an existing bundle.
tccc.entry.dyed_bundles.page_1.descripti: This recipe accepts any color dye.
tccc.entry.dyed_bundles.title: –ö—Ä–∞—à–µ–Ω—ã–µ –º–µ—à–∫–∏
tccc.entry.echo_shard_renewability.page_: When a sculk shrieker that can summon a warden is triggered, any amethyst clusters hit by its shriek particles will be broken and drop an echo shard. Very useful for %s, %s, and %s, but also dangerous!
tccc.entry.echo_shard_renewability.title: –í–æ–∑–æ–±–Ω–æ–≤–ª—è–µ–º–æ—Å—Ç—å –æ—Å–∫–æ–ª–∫–æ–≤ —ç—Ö–∞
tccc.entry.echoing_hourglass.hint: This unique archaeology tool is crafted using a rare shard from the deep dark.
tccc.entry.echoing_hourglass.page_0.desc: The echoing hourglass is a useful tool for renewability. When placed within a structure's bounding box, sand/gravel placed inside it will turn into its suspicious variant after 40s, with loot inside according to the structure.
tccc.entry.echoing_hourglass.page_1.desc: This only works in structures with archaeology. With TCC's other renewability and archaeology features, this allows every sherd and trim (except Rib, Spire, and Eye) to be renewable. This block also works with hoppers.
tccc.entry.echoing_hourglass.page_2.desc: Hourglasses also have a unique animation as they make sand or gravel suspicious.
tccc.entry.echoing_hourglass.page_3.desc:
A very costly recipe, but very worth it.

Experiment and see what you can renew!
tccc.entry.elder_guardian_improvements.p: Elder guardians now clear mining fatigue when you kill them. They also give it constantly while you're in the monument to prevent cheesing. They also drop 1-2 nautilus shells. Guardians struck by lightning turn into elder guardians.
tccc.entry.emoji.page_0.description: If you type "/trigger tcc.emoji" in chat, a menu will come up with many various emoji you can click to print out. Each emoji has its own number as well. For example, running "/trigger tcc.emoji set 3" makes an angry emoji. Express yourself!
tccc.entry.emoji.title: –≠–º–æ–¥–∑–∏
tccc.entry.enchanted_golden_carrot.page_: Enchanted golden carrots give you night vision for five minutes. They give the same amount of hunger as a normal golden carrot.
Same recipe as normal golden carrots, but with gold ingots instead of gold nuggets.
tccc.entry.enchanter.page_0.description: Enchanters are a "support" illager that help hostile mobs with magic buffs. They are the main inhabitants of the %s. They also spawn in raids and will drop %s when spawned in raids.
tccc.entry.enchanter.page_1.description: Enchanters care more about reading than you. They're entirely harmless aside from their support buffs.
tccc.entry.end_city_loot_improvements.hi: These large complexes in the end now have better loot.
tccc.entry.end_city_loot_improvements.pa: You can now find %s in end cities, as well as iron axes, diamond axes, lapis lazuli, and name tags. These items replace the inventory-clogging horse armors, beetroot seeds, and saddles previously found here.
tccc.entry.fishing_treasure_particles.pa: Small bubble pop particles now spawn around fishing bobbers if the area you're fishing in is too small to yield treasure. This feature is especially helpful for %s.
An example of the particles spawning in a small 2√ó2 pool that is too small for treasure.
tccc.entry.fortitude_potion.page_0.descr: Fortitude potions give health boost for 3 minutes, and are brewed from %s. They can be extended to 8 minutes, or amplified to give health boost II for 1.5 minutes. They can also be %s using %s.
tccc.entry.frost_walker_horses.page_0.de: When riding a horse, skeleton horse, or donkey and wearing frost walker boots, the horse will also leave a trail of ice.
tccc.entry.frost_walker_horses.title: –õ–æ—à–∞–¥–∏-–ª–µ–¥–æ—Ö–æ–¥—ã
tccc.entry.frost_walker_mounts.hint: This icy enchantment allows you to walk on water.
tccc.entry.frost_walker_mounts.page_0.de: When riding any mount and wearing frost walker boots, the mount will also leave a trail of ice. Makes horses much more useful, and prevents your striders from taking damage from the cold water.
tccc.entry.frost_walker_mounts.title: Frost Walker Mounts
tccc.entry.frostbloom_petals.page_0.desc: When eaten, these petals give regeneration II for 8 seconds, as well as slowness II for 30 seconds. Very powerful healing, but at the cost of your mobility.
tccc.entry.frostbloom_petals.page_1.desc: Frostbloom petals drop from %s when bone-mealed, and are dropped by strays 5%% of the time and by %s 50%% of the time. They can be made into a %s too.
tccc.entry.frostbloom.page_0.description: The frostbloom is a magic flower found in the %s or dug up by %s in cold biomes. It forms snow layers around it, freezes water -> ice -> packed ice -> blue ice, fills cauldrons with powdered snow, turns lava into magma, and puts out fire.
tccc.entry.frostbloom.page_1.description: It also damages blazes, magma cubes, and striders and heals snow golems. When bone-mealed, it drops %s.
tccc.entry.frostbloom.page_2.description: The room in the %s that the frostbloom is found in.
tccc.entry.fungal_stew.page_0.descriptio: You can now make a stew by combining both crimson and warped fungi. It gives as much hunger as mushroom stew, and makes surviving in the nether easier without any other food sources.
tccc.entry.fungal_stew.page_1.descriptio: The above recipe is shapeless, and can be placed anywhere in the crafting menu.
tccc.entry.geomancer.page_0.description: Geomancers are very strange and terrifying illagers that only spawn in the deepslate layer of the caves. They summon magical pillars to trap and explode you, which can be quite a dangerous combo.
tccc.entry.geomancer.page_1.description: They drop amethyst shards and %s. They also drop 1-2 %s.
tccc.entry.geomancer.page_2.description: Look at those tattered clothes and ratty beard... he's been down in the caves a while.
tccc.entry.gilded_blackstone_rework.hint: This blackstone block has veins of yellow embedded.
tccc.entry.gilded_blackstone_rework.page: Gilded blackstone has been reworked to function similarly to an ore. It now drops the same amount of nuggets as nether gold ore, and can be smelted down to an ingot when silk-touched into its block form.
tccc.entry.glazed_terracotta_pots.hint: These decorative pots are made with a colorful glazed block set.
tccc.entry.glazed_terracotta_pots.page_0: Glazed terracotta pots are new decorative blocks with 16 fun variants to make!
tccc.entry.glazed_terracotta_pots.page_1:
All 16 colors of glazed terracotta pot.

So many choices to pick from!
tccc.entry.glazed_terracotta_pots.title: Glazed Terracotta Pots
tccc.entry.glow_berry_muffin.page_0.desc: Glow berry muffins are a tasty food item. They're also superior to eating plain glow berries, since you can't accidentally plant them.
tccc.entry.glow_berry_muffin.page_1.desc: The above recipe is shapeless, and can also be made in the 2√ó2 crafting menu. Muffins on the go!
tccc.entry.glow_lichen_zombie.page_0.des: The glow lichen zombie spawns rarely in the deepslate layer of the world. It gives the blindness effect on hit, and drops glow lichen and the %s. It spawns more commonly in lush caves as well.
tccc.entry.glow_lichen_zombie.page_1.des: What a spooky mob... just look at those black eyes. A terror of the deep caves for sure.
tccc.entry.glow_lichen_zombie.title: –ó–æ–º–±–∏ –∏–∑ —Å–≤–µ—Ç—è—â–µ–≥–æ—Å—è –ª–∏—à–∞–π–Ω–∏–∫–∞
tccc.entry.gobblerift.page_0.description: The gobblerift is a very unique carnivorous plant found within %s in a growable seedling form. You can grow it from this seedling stage using lots of bonemeal. After growing to full size, it becomes hungry.
tccc.entry.gobblerift.page_1.description: This hunger can only be satisfied by feeding it about 64 pieces of meat. After feeding, it digests for several minutes and forms %s you can harvest with a glass bottle. This mechanic is explained on its own page, linked above.
tccc.entry.gobblerift.page_2.description: The various stages of gobblerift growth, including the filled stage at the end.
tccc.entry.golden_apple_pie.page_0.descr: Golden apple pie is the gold variant of %s. When eaten, it provides haste for 6 minutes and speed for 2 minutes. There is also an enchanted golden apple variant that gives haste II for 15 minutes and speed II for 5 minutes.
tccc.entry.golden_apple_pie.page_1.descr: The above recipe is shapeless, meaning it can be put anywhere in the crafting space.
tccc.entry.golden_chorus_fruit.page_0.de: Golden chorus fruit is the golden variant of chorus fruit. Rather than teleporting you a short distance, it teleports you very far. The maximum distance is around 2000 blocks. Great for a quick getaway!
tccc.entry.golden_chorus_fruit.page_1.de: Similar to a golden apple‚Äîjust cover the thing in gold ingots!
tccc.entry.grouped_glazed_terracotta_rec: The glazed terracotta recipes are now grouped in the furnace, rather than taking up 16 different spaces.
tccc.entry.hay_vibration_dampening.page_: Hay blocks can now be used to dampen sculk vibrations, similarly to wool blocks and carpet.
tccc.entry.hay_vibration_dampening.title: –°–µ–Ω–æ–≤–æ–π –≥–∞—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å –≤–∏–±—Ä–∞—Ü–∏–∏
tccc.entry.heartbeet.page_0.description: Heartbeets are a rare food dropped by fully grown beetroot plants 5%% of the time. They give 30 seconds of health boost when eaten, and fill as much hunger as a golden carrot. They can also be brewed into %s.
tccc.entry.iceologer.page_0.description: The iceologer is a dangerous illager wizard that summons massive blocks of falling ice, and freezes you directly if you retreat under cover. They also drop %s, and spawn in the %s and raids in snowy biomes.
tccc.entry.iceologer.page_1.description: Just look at that icy stare! Brrr...
tccc.entry.improved_prismarine_recipes.p:
The recipes for prismarine bricks, dark prismarine, and sea lanterns have been tweaked to be more consistent with other blocks.

Additionally, prismarine can now be %s into prismarine bricks.
Prismarine bricks are now made like every other brick in the game, instead of being 9 prismarine shards.
Dark prismarine is now made from 8 prismarine and an ink sac, instead of 8 shards and black dye.
Sea lanterns are now made from 4 crystals, rather than a weird mish-mash of shards and crystals.
tccc.entry.improved_trident_enchantments: An enchantment for a weapon from the ocean depths has become more powerful.
The loyalty enchantment now allows tridents to return even when you accidentally throw them into the void. Also, impaling now deals more damage to mobs in water or rain instead of just aquatic mobs.
tccc.entry.improved_trident_loyalty.page: The loyalty enchantment now allows tridents to return even when you accidentally throw them into the void.
tccc.entry.increased_chain_yield.hint: This climbable, iron-based decoration block is now much cheaper.
The chain recipe now yields 4 chains rather than 1. Good for decor and using %s.
tccc.entry.increased_chain_yield.title: Increased Chain Yield
tccc.entry.increased_emerald_ore_drops.h: This green ore now drops more.
tccc.entry.increased_emerald_ore_drops.p: Emerald ore now drops 1-4 emeralds, rather than just 1, making exploring mountains with fortune III a slightly more viable option for getting a few emeralds.
tccc.entry.increased_lodestone_yield.hin: This navigational block made from netherite has become more useable.
tccc.entry.increased_lodestone_yield.pag: The lodestone recipe now yields 8 lodestones rather than 1. Much more usable!
tccc.entry.increased_shulker_drops.page_: Shulkers now drop 1-2 shulker shells, rather than 0-1. With looting III, they will always drop two shells.
tccc.entry.increased_shulker_drops.title: –£–≤–µ–ª–∏—á–µ–Ω–Ω–∞—è –¥–æ–±—ã—á–∞ –∏–∑ —à–∞–ª–∫–µ—Ä–æ–≤
tccc.entry.jungle_temple_rework.page_0.d: Jungle temples have been reworked with more rooms and a whole underground area. At the end, the %s awaits, giving you mining fatigue until it is collected. To get to the lower sections of the temple, you must solve a lever puzzle.
tccc.entry.jungle_temple_rework.page_1.d: The outside of the temple. Maybe those pillars could represent something...
tccc.entry.jungle_temple_rework.page_2.d: Jungle %s villagers (those with a jungle outfit, found in %s) also trade a map to this structure if you can't find one in the dense jungle.
tccc.entry.jungle_temple_rework.title: –ü–µ—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–∫–∞ —Ç—Ä–æ–ø–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Ö—Ä–∞–º–∞
tccc.entry.locket_of_learning.page_0.des:
The locket is a helpful enchanting tool. On right-click, it stores experience points, and when shift-right-
clicked, it gives you points back. It is dropped by %s, and can be found in %s.
tccc.entry.locket_of_learning.page_1.des: Various levels of filled lockets. At max fill, a locket stores enough xp to take you from 0 to 30 levels.
tccc.entry.logical_white_tulip_recipe.pa: The WHITE tulip now crafts into WHITE dye instead of light gray dye.
tccc.entry.mace_renewability.hint: This weapon with a heavy smash attack has been made renewable.
tccc.entry.mace_renewability.page_0.desc: Zombies and husks spawning from ominous trial spawners now have a rare chance to spawn holding a heavily damaged wind burst I mace, which they drop 10%% of the time. Renewable, but very very difficult. Good luck.
tccc.entry.mace_renewability.title: Mace Renewability
tccc.entry.more_cat_morning_gifts.page_0: Cats can now bring %s and 'cat' music discs as part of their morning gift pool.
tccc.entry.more_cat_morning_gifts.title: –ï—â—ë –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ —É—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–∏—Ö –∫–æ—à–∞—á—å–∏—Ö –ø–æ–¥–∞—Ä–∫–æ–≤
tccc.entry.more_flower_pots.hint: These flower-holding blocks can now be made out of more materials.
tccc.entry.more_flower_pots.page_0.descr: You can now craft new flower pot variants out of prismarine shards and nether bricks.
tccc.entry.more_flower_pots.page_1.descr: Very useful for decorating in tandem with the new %s and %s pottery.
tccc.entry.more_flower_pots.title: More Flower Pots
tccc.entry.more_illager_banners.hint: These unique wall decorations can be found in several illager structures.
tccc.entry.more_illager_banners.page_0.d: New variants of the ominous banner can be found in TCC's illager structures. The "Chilling" banner can be found in %s, while the "Sinister" banner can be found in %s. Collect them all for a fun advancement!
tccc.entry.more_illager_banners.page_1.d: All the banners on display, from left to right: Ominous, Chilling, and Sinister.
tccc.entry.more_illager_banners.title: More Illager Banners
tccc.entry.more_mineable_blocks.page_0.d: More blocks now have proper tools. Glass-like blocks, levers, frosted ice, and heads can now be mined faster with picks. Cactus, cakes, honeycomb, candles, melons, pumpkins, and froglights can be mined faster with hoes.
tccc.entry.more_mineable_blocks.title: –ë–æ–ª—å—à–µ –ø—Ä–∏–≥–æ–¥–Ω—ã—Ö –¥–ª—è –¥–æ–±—ã—á–∏ –±–ª–æ–∫–æ–≤
tccc.entry.more_mossy_recipes.page_0.des: Mossy cobblestone and mossy stone brick blocks (stairs, walls, and slabs) can now be crafted with a single moss block or vine combined with the non-mossy block you wish to mossify. No more wasting resources if you just want one mossy block!
tccc.entry.more_mossy_recipes.title: –ï—â—ë –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ –∑–∞–º—à–µ–ª—ã—Ö —Ä–µ—Ü–µ–ø—Ç–æ–≤
tccc.entry.more_potted_plants.page_0.des: Rose bushes, twisting vines, sunflowers, lilacs, peonies, pitcher plants, small dripleafs, big dripleafs, chorus flowers, sweet berries, %s, and %s can now all be placed in flower pots.
tccc.entry.more_potted_plants.title: –ï—â—ë –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ —Ä–∞—Å—Ç–µ–Ω–∏–π –≤ –≥–æ—Ä—à–∫–∞—Ö
tccc.entry.more_sniffer_loot.page_0.desc: Sniffers now dig up 1-3 ancient seeds at a time, rather than just one at a time. They can also dig up %s when in cold biomes.
tccc.entry.more_sniffer_loot.title: –ë–æ–ª—å—à–µ –¥–æ–±—ã—á–∏ –Ω—é—Ö–∞—á–∞
tccc.entry.more_stone_substitutions.page: Cobbled deepslate and blackstone can now be used to craft dispensers, droppers, pistons, observers, and levers. Additionally, raw deepslate can be used to craft repeaters, stonecutters, and comparators.
tccc.entry.more_stonecutter_recipes.page: Stone and deepslate can be cut into cobblestone and cobbled deepslate to make building easier when working with silk touch. Also, prismarine can be cut into prismarine bricks.
You can now make suspicious stew from chorus flowers to give yourself 10 seconds of levitation, with flowering azaleas to give yourself 20 seconds of water breathing, or with pink petals to give yourself regeneration for 10 seconds.
tccc.entry.more_suspicious_stews.title: –ë–æ–ª–µ–µ –ø–æ–¥–æ–∑—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ —Ä–∞–≥—É
tccc.entry.nausea_potion.page_0.descript: The nausea potion is made by brewing %s into an awkward potion. It gives 30s of Nausea, which can be extended to 60s with redstone. It cannot be amplified with glowstone, but it can be %s with %s.
tccc.entry.nether_brick_pottery.page_0.d: You can now make decorated pots using nether bricks, and decorate them with rare sherds from the %s using a %s. There are 15 different sherds to collect!
tccc.entry.nether_brick_pottery.page_1.d: Here is every single sherd pattern you can collect. Good luck!
tccc.entry.nether_brick_pottery.page_2.d: This is the recipe for the blank pot. To decorate it with sherds, use a %s!
tccc.entry.nether_brick_pottery.page_3.d: This is the recipe for the blank pot. To decorate it with sherds, use a %s!
tccc.entry.nether_brick_pottery.title: –ì–æ–Ω—á–∞—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–æ –∏–∑ –Ω–µ–∑–µ—Ä—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∫–∏—Ä–ø–∏—á–∞
tccc.entry.nether_gold_ore_vein.hint: This massive deposit of ore can be found in the basalt deltas.
tccc.entry.nether_gold_ore_vein.page_0.d: Massive veins of %s now spawn rarely in basalt deltas, with small amounts of raw gold blocks hidden below the ore surface. These veins can have >3000 blocks of gilded blackstone, so keep an eye out in your local basalt deltas!
tccc.entry.nether_gold_ore_vein.title: Nether Gold Ore Vein
tccc.entry.nether_reactor.page_0.descrip: The nether reactor gives friendly mobs (players, tamed mobs, villagers, etc.) fire resistance, gives striders Speed III, and clears Wither I in a 64 block radius. It is activated using a complex structure shown on the next page.
tccc.entry.nether_reactor.page_1.descrip: In order to form a full reactor, you make the above multiblock structure, building from layer 1 upwards.
tccc.entry.nether_reactor.page_2.descrip: It is made using lots of valuables, including a nether star... good luck!
tccc.entry.nether_reactor.title: –ù–µ–∑–µ—Ä—Å–∫–∏–π —Ä–µ–∞–∫—Ç–æ—Ä
The ocean monument has been reworked to include better loot and a better build. You get a trident, 10 gold blocks, 64 sponge, and plenty of %s. Just don't get lost trying to find all the loot.
The outside is quite a bit more detailed than the original, as you can see in this image.
tccc.entry.ocean_monument_rework.title: –ü–µ—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª–∫–∞ –æ–∫–µ–∞–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –º–æ–Ω—É–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞
tccc.entry.ocean_ruin_archaeology_rework: These abandoned underwater structures have received a loot rework.
Ocean ruins now have better archaeology. You can now find nautilus shells and coast armor trims. In cold ocean ruins, you can find %s as a counterpart to the sniffer eggs found in warm ocean ruins.
You can find these %s as well: "Artifact", "Catch", "Ink", "Protector", and "Shell" in cold ocean ruins, and "Idol", "Pickle", "Reef", "Turtle", and "Voyager" in warm ocean ruins.
The sherds that were previously found here have been moved: "Angler", "Shelter", and "Snort" to the %s, "Plenty" and "Mourner" to the %s, and "Blade" and "Explorer" to the %s.
Swamp %s villagers (those with a swamp outfit, found in %s) also trade a map to both types of ocean ruin if you can't find one in the vast oceans.
tccc.entry.overgrown.page_0.description: The overgrown is a new skeleton variant that spawns in jungles and %s. It has a 5%% chance to drop a wild armor trim, making it %s. It shoots poison arrows. Creepers killed by overgrown %s.
tccc.entry.overgrown.page_1.description: They have a 10%% chance to spawn with bamboo embedded in their head. Goofy monsters.
tccc.entry.paintbrush.page_0.description: The paintbrush is a tool used to paint blocks with dye. It can be used on concrete, shulker boxes, etc. It can also cycle paintings' art and paint shulkers. It prioritizes dyes in your offhand, and also can be used from the offhand.
tccc.entry.paintbrush.page_1.description: Nice and cheap for a handy tool!
tccc.entry.phantom_item_frame.page_0.des: The phantom item frame is an amazing tool for decoration, and another use for phantom membranes. When you place an item in it, the frame surrounding it will turn invisible, leaving only the item.
tccc.entry.phantom_item_frame.page_1.des: The different stages of placing an item in the phantom item frame, from left to right.
tccc.entry.phantom_item_frame.page_2.des: Just like the normal item frame recipe, but with phantom membrane instead of leather.
tccc.entry.pig_improvements.page_0.descr: In order to make pigs a better mob and allow them to keep up with other livestock, they will now have 2-3 babies when breeding rather than just one. The chance for 3 babies at once is 50%.
tccc.entry.pig_improvements.title: –°–≤–∏–Ω—ã–µ —É–ª—É—á—à–µ–Ω–∏—è
These nether-dwelling pigs now barter more interesting goods.

Piglins can now rarely barter suspicious gravel instead of normal gravel, which can contain 1 of 3 %s: "Beast", "Hunter", or "Ranger". It can also rarely have the "Snout" armor trim, making it renewable.
tccc.entry.positional_anchor.page_0.desc: The positional anchor is a useful technical block. When you insert an ender pearl inside it and power it, it will fire said ender pearl, teleporting you. It's very efficient for multiplayer or short-distance transport.
tccc.entry.positional_anchor.page_1.desc: It requires valuable crying obsidian, similarly to the other "anchor" block, the respawn anchor.
tccc.entry.pottery_sherd_renewability.pa: Pottery sherds are now renewable and mass-producible. You can change a sherd's pattern using the %s and obtain many sherds to change using a %s. The "seed" sherds are renewable, as seen on the next pages.

Trail Ruin Sherds: Dropped by %s

Ocean Ruin Sherds: Fished up rarely above ocean ruins

Desert Sherds: Found in suspicious sand rarely dropped by husks

%s: Found in suspicious gravel rarely bartered by piglins, and the 'crop' sherd is sold by the wandering witch.

%s: Dropped by guardians 5%% of the time.
tccc.entry.pottery_table.page_0.descript: The pottery table is a new block that is required to decorate pots. You can no longer do it in the crafting table. It can also change the pattern of pottery sherds and is a %s for villagers.
tccc.entry.pottery_table.page_1.descript: The planks in this recipe can be of any wood, not just oak.
tccc.entry.prismarine_pottery.page_0.des: You can now make decorated pots using prismarine shards, and decorate them with rare sherds from the %s using a %s. Guardians also drop these sherds 5%% of the time. There are 10 different sherds to collect!
tccc.entry.prismarine_pottery.page_1.des: Here is every single sherd pattern you can collect. Good luck!
tccc.entry.prismarine_pottery.page_2.des: This is the recipe for the blank pot. To decorate it with sherds, use a %s!
tccc.entry.prismarine_pottery.title: –ü—Ä–∏–∑–º–∞—Ä–∏–Ω–æ–≤–æ–µ –≥–æ–Ω—á–∞—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–æ
tccc.entry.quarry_remnant.page_0.descrip: The quarry remnant is a long-forgotten piglin mine, filled to the brim with ancient debris and loot. The center of the structure has a burnt out %s, emanating an energy that the %s can pick up.
tccc.entry.quarry_remnant.page_1.descrip: The structure contains many magma cube spawners, and rewards at least 13 ancient debris. The structure has many winding hallways, so be sure to bring plenty of blocks to keep track of where you've been.
tccc.entry.quarry_remnant.page_2.descrip: It also has archaeology with 3 %s: "Armor", "Core", and "Molten", as well as netherite upgrades. If the %s is installed, the "Remnant" armor trim can also be found in the structure's loot.
tccc.entry.quarry_remnant.title: Quarry Remnant
tccc.entry.ravager_sentry_armor_trim_dro: This gigantic raiding monster has a new rare drop.

Ravagers now have a 10%% chance to drop a sentry armor trim, making it possible to obtain this trim through multiple challenging raids instead of exploring thousands of blocks.

This also makes the trim renewable.
tccc.entry.reactive_seeker.hint: This expensive guide can be crafted using netherite scrap.
tccc.entry.reactive_seeker.page_0.descri:
The reactive seeker detects a unique energy signature while in the nether, leading you to a %s...

The bar in the middle will increase if you're facing the right way.
tccc.entry.reactive_seeker.page_1.descri: Costly, but the investment is well worth it.
tccc.entry.recovery_compass_rework.page_: The recovery compass has been fully reworked. When you die with a recovery compass in your inventory, the items you drop will glow blue and never despawn. Additionally, the recovery compass will respawn with you.
tccc.entry.recovery_compass_rework.title: –ü–µ—Ä–µ—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ –∫–æ–º–ø–∞—Å–∞ –≤–æ—Å—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è
tccc.entry.refuge_remains.page_0.descrip: The refuge remains is a new nether cousin to the trail ruins. It is found in soul sand valleys and is filled with suspicious gravel with %s and other loot such as ancient debris and diamonds.
tccc.entry.refuge_remains.page_1.descrip: The top of the refuge remains peeking through the surface of the soil sand. What could be down there?
tccc.entry.refuge_remains.page_2.descrip: The top of the refuge remains peeking out from the lava. What could be down there?
tccc.entry.refuge_remains.title: –û—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–∫–∏ —É–±–µ–∂–∏—â–∞
tccc.entry.riftjuice_bottle.page_0.descr: Riftjuice is a special liquid harvested from %s. When drank, it teleports you back to the location of the gobblerift you took it from. This works even if you break and move the gobblerift to a new location. It can also be made into a %s.
tccc.entry.riftjuice_bottle.page_1.descr:
You can also rename the gobblerift in an anvil, and that name will appear in the lore of the riftjuice that you harvest from it.

Useful if you want to quickly organize each of your destinations.
tccc.entry.rotten_porkchop.page_0.descri: This food item drops from zombified piglins and zoglins, and replaces their rotten flesh drop. Make sure you cook it before eating, otherwise it gives nausea for 30 seconds. It also angers zombie piglins... they don't like it when you eat their friends.
tccc.entry.scalesprouts.hint: Shear the neck of the sniffer's long-lost cousin.
tccc.entry.scalesprouts.page_0.descripti: Scalesprouts are a unique ingredient obtained by shearing a %s. When brewed into a thick potion (not an awkward potion), you can obtain a "Serum of Sprouting", which permanently grows you, up to a maximum of 3 blocks tall.
tccc.entry.scalesprouts.page_1.descripti: You can also invert serums with fermented spider eyes to make a "Serum of Shrinking", which permanently shrinks you, up to a minimum of 1 block tall. The limit for both variants can be reached by drinking 3 serums. Your scale resets with milk.
tccc.entry.scalesprouts.page_2.descripti:
Changing your scale also affects your reach, jump height, and safe fall distance.

Experiment around with the 6 possible sizes and figure out which one you like the best!
tccc.entry.sculk_recipe.page_0.descripti: Sculk can now be crafted from four sculk vein in a square shape. This recipe was added when I realized how much sculk was needed for %s and how useless sculk veins were.
tccc.entry.sculk_recipe.page_1.descripti: This recipe is only 2√ó2, so it can be made in your inventory as well for convenience.
tccc.entry.sculk_recipe.title: –†–µ—Ü–µ–ø—Ç —Å–∫–∞–ª–∫–∞
tccc.entry.sightless_eye.page_0.descript: The sightless eye is an rare ingredient, dropped from %s about 10%% of the time. It can be brewed into %s, and can also be used to make a %s.
tccc.entry.silk_touch_improvements.page_: Silk touch now picks up farmland, grass paths, filled composters, infested blocks, and charged respawn anchors. Bee nests and hives will also show if they have honey in the inventory as well.
tccc.entry.silk_touch_improvements.title: –£–ª—É—á—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ —à—ë–ª–∫–æ–≤–æ–≥–æ –∫–∞—Å–∞–Ω–∏—è
tccc.entry.smithing_template_renewabilit:
Many (but not all) smithing templates are now renewable via various methods.

These methods are listed on the next pages.

Coast: Can be fished up above shipwrecks

Sentry: Dropped 1/10th of the time by ravagers

Vex: Dropped 1/3rd of the time by evokers in mansions

Dune: Found in suspicious sand rarely dropped by husks

Tide: Dropped from elder guardians, which are renewable by striking guardians with %s

Eye: Dropped by the ender dragon 1/3rd of the time

Snout: Found in suspicious gravel rarely traded by piglins

%s trade the four trail ruins trims.

Netherite Upgrade: Dropped by the wither

Wild: Dropped by %s 10%% of the time.

Rib, Spire, Silence, Ward: Nonrenewable [for now ;)]
tccc.entry.smoldering_seeker.page_0.desc: Smoldering seekers are special compasses crafted with nether bricks that point to nether fortresses when clicked in the nether. No more searching for eons! They can also be bound to lodestones for a cooler base compass.
tccc.entry.smoldering_seeker.page_1.desc: A simple recipe... the real challenge is following the compass through the treacherous nether.
tccc.entry.snail_mucus.page_0.descriptio: Snail mucus is the main product of the %s, and is created after feeding it beetroot. It can be used to lengthen the effects of %s, and also can be used as slime in recipes.
tccc.entry.snail.page_0.description: Groups of snails naturally spawn in swamps. They can't handle saltwater, so the swamp is perfect!
tccc.entry.snail.page_1.description: Snails are an adorable, portable slime farm that spawn in swamps. When fed beetroot, they have a 1%% chance per second to spawn %s, lasting for 20 minutes. When fed %s, this chance increases to 5%%.
tccc.entry.snail.page_2.description: You can also breed two snails together using beetroot soup. Then, wait for the pregnant snail to lay its eggs into a clay block beneath it. Then after about 30 minutes, more snails hatch from the block along with lots of clay and %s.
tccc.entry.snail.page_3.description:
There are six total variants of snail: Yellow, brown, black, cyan, spiral, and the final secret variant.

To find that variant, you'll have to take a snail nest using silk touch and go do some soul-searching in the nether...
tccc.entry.soul_conductor.page_0.descrip: The soul conductor is a powerful transport block. Attaching two conductors with sculk and clicking one will transport you to the other. There are also complex mechanics involving more than two conductors, which are described in %s.
tccc.entry.soul_conductor.page_1.descrip: The soul conductor also has redstone interactions. When powered, it deactivates and cannot be entered nor exited. Any sculk that the conductor scans during the transport will trigger observers pointing into said sculk.
tccc.entry.soul_conductor.page_2.descrip: It's crafted using two echo shards, making it a powerful, unique reward for the deep dark.
tccc.entry.soul_seer.page_0.description: The soul seer is a useful redstone component. When powered or clicked, it make mobs glow in a 24 block radius. The type of mob is based on the block beneath the soul seer. A full list of these blocks can be found %s.
tccc.entry.soul_seer.page_1.description: It can also be used as a mob detector. The comparator output of the block represents the number of mobs it highlights. If you placed tinted glass on top, it will only give comparator output and will not make any mobs glow.
tccc.entry.soul_seer.page_2.description: It's crafted with sculk, making it a useful reward for looting the deep dark.
tccc.entry.spider_cobweb_drop.page_0.des: Spiders and cave spiders now have a 2.5%% chance to drop a cobweb on death, making cobwebs renewable.
tccc.entry.spider_cobweb_drop.title: –î–æ–±—ã—á–∞ –ø–∞—É—á—å–µ–π –ø–∞—É—Ç–∏–Ω—ã
tccc.entry.sprouter.hint: This ancient mob's eggs can be found in cold ocean ruins.
tccc.entry.sprouter.page_0.description: Sprouters are a long-lost cousin of the sniffer. Their eggs are found in %s. Their necks sprout %s, which can be sheared off once they have grown to full size, and are also the item used to breed them.
tccc.entry.sprouter.page_1.description: Two sprouters next to each other. The left one's mane is ready for its %s to be sheared.
tccc.entry.sweet_berry_muffin.page_0.des: Sweet berry muffins are a tasty food item. They're also superior to eating plain sweet berries, since you can't accidentally plant them.
tccc.entry.sweet_berry_muffin.page_1.des: The above recipe is shapeless, and can also be made in the 2√ó2 crafting menu. Muffins on the go!
tccc.entry.swift_sneak_renewability.page: You can now rarely fish up swift sneak enchanted books by fishing in the deep dark. Just make sure that the pool you're fishing in is large enough to get %s.
tccc.entry.swordfish.page_0.description: The swordfish is a food... or is it a weapon? Who knows! It can be fished up about 1%% of the time, or 2%% when you're in a frozen ocean biome due to %s. Drowned also spawn with them 5%% of the time.
tccc.entry.tangling_pearl.page_0.descrip: The tangling pearl is a simple item made from twisting vines and an ender pearl. When right-clicked, it turns on and will teleport nearby items and xp to you when in your inventory. It does not teleport items you drop. Right-click again to turn it off.
tccc.entry.tangling_pearl.page_1.descrip: That's a lot of twisting vines. Good luck finding a warped forest.
tccc.entry.tea.page_0.description: Tea is a remedy to negative potion effects. It is made using a teapot, %s, and an ingredient. It gives a 5-minute immunity to a specific negative effect, depending on the ingredient used. The next pages explain this process.
tccc.entry.tea.page_1.description:
To make a specific tea:
1. Add water bottle
2. Add %s
3. Add your ingredient
4. Add %s to extend duration of tea to 7:30 (optional)
5. Take out your tea with a glass bottle

The next pages list ingredients/immunities.
tccc.entry.tea.page_2.description:
Wither Rose: Wither

Dandelion: Nausea

Torchflower: Blindness

Ink Sac: Glowing

Honey Bottle: Poison
tccc.entry.tea.page_3.description:
Sweet Berries: Hunger

Wet Sponge: Mining Fatigue

%s: Weakness

%s: Slowness

%s: Levitation
tccc.entry.tea.page_4.description:
Rabbit's Foot: Bad Luck

Echo Shard: Darkness

Darkness immunity tea works especially well with the %s mechanic.
tccc.entry.tea.page_5.description:
Pitcher Plant: Infested

Armadillo Scute: Weaving

Turtle Scute: Wind Charged

Tadpole Bucket: Oozing
tccc.entry.tea.page_6.description: The teapot must be placed on a lit campfire to make tea inside it.
tccc.entry.tea.title: –ß–∞–π
tccc.entry.totem_improvements.title: –£–ª—É—á—à–µ–Ω–∏—è —Ç–æ—Ç–µ–º–∞
tccc.entry.trial_chamber_archaeology.hin: This copper and tuff structure is found underground.
tccc.entry.trial_chamber_archaeology.pag: Dead ends in trial chambers will now include small sections of suspicious gravel at dead ends, instead of cobbled deepslate. The loot contains trial chamber sherds, trims, and banner patterns.
tccc.entry.tundra_keep.title: –ö—Ä–µ–ø–æ—Å—Ç—å –≤ —Ç—É–Ω–¥—Ä–µ
tccc.entry.village_cherry_grove.title: –î–µ—Ä–µ–≤–Ω—è –≤ –≤–∏—à–Ω—ë–≤–æ–π —Ä–æ—â–µ
tccc.entry.village_mangrove_swamp.title: –î–µ—Ä–µ–≤–Ω—è –≤ –º–∞–Ω–≥—Ä–æ–≤—ã—Ö –±–æ–ª–æ—Ç–∞—Ö
tccc.entry.village_sparse_jungle.title: –î–µ—Ä–µ–≤–Ω—è –≤ —Ä–µ–¥–∫–∏—Ö –¥–∂—É–Ω–≥–ª—è—Ö
tccc.entry.wandering_trader_rework.title: –ü–µ—Ä–µ—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–µ–≥–æ —Ç–æ—Ä–≥–æ–≤—Ü–∞
tccc.entry.wandering_witch.page_3.descri:
6. 10 spider eyes for mycelium or crimson/warped nylium

7. 2 fermented spider eyes for the 'crop' %s

8. 4 fermented spider eyes for an ender pearl
tccc.entry.wandering_witch.page_4.descri:
9. 8 fermented spider eyes for an explorer map to an ancient city (66%%) or swamp hut (33%%)
